001import java.util.StringTokenizer;
002
003/**
004 * This class is part of "World of Zuul". "World of Zuul" is a simple, 
005 * text based adventure game.
006 *
007 * This parser takes user input and tries to interpret it as a "Zuul"
008 * command. Every time it is called it takes a line as a String and
009 * tries to interpret the line as a two word command. It returns the command
010 * as an object of class Command.
011 *
012 * The parser has a set of known command words. It checks user input against
013 * the known commands, and if the input is not one of the known commands, it
014 * returns a command object that is marked as an unknown command.
015 * 
016 * @author  Michael Kolling and David J. Barnes
017 * @version 2.0 (Jan 2003) DB edited (2019)
018 */
019
020public class Parser 
021{
022    /**
023     * Une ligne de commande à portée privée
024     */
025    private CommandWords aCommandWords;  // holds all valid command words
026
027    /**
028     * Create a new Parser.
029     */
030    public Parser() 
031    {
032        this.aCommandWords = new CommandWords();
033    } // Parser()
034
035    /**
036     * Get a new command from the user. The command is read by
037     * parsing the 'inputLine'.
038     * 
039     * @param pInputLine Input line
040     * @return Command from the input
041     */
042    public Command getCommand( final String pInputLine ) 
043    {
044        String vWord1;
045        String vWord2;
046
047        StringTokenizer tokenizer = new StringTokenizer( pInputLine );
048
049        if ( tokenizer.hasMoreTokens() )
050            vWord1 = tokenizer.nextToken();      // get first word
051        else
052            vWord1 = null;
053
054        if ( tokenizer.hasMoreTokens() )
055            vWord2 = tokenizer.nextToken();      // get second word
056        else
057            vWord2 = null;
058
059        // note: we just ignore the rest of the input line.
060
061        // Now check whether this word is known. If so, create a command
062        // with it. If not, create a "null" command (for unknown command).
063
064        if ( this.aCommandWords.isCommand( vWord1 ) )
065            return new Command( vWord1, vWord2 );
066        else
067            return new Command( null, vWord2 );
068    } // getCommand(.)
069
070    /**
071     * Returns a String with valid command words.
072     * 
073     * @return String with available commands
074     */
075    public String getCommandString() // was showCommands()
076    {
077        return this.aCommandWords.getCommandList();
078    } // getCommandString()
079
080} // Parser
